The president of the Council of Ministers, Mirtha Vasquez met this afternoon with leaders of indigenous communities in the Amazon to analyze the problem of land titling in the regions of Hu?nuco, Ucayali and Jun?n, and promote this process, which in some cases already it is in an advanced stage.

The delegation of indigenous leaders was led by the president of the Aidesep Ucayali Regional Organization (Orau), Berlin Diques Ru?z, and was attended by representatives of the Inter-ethnic Association for the Development of the Peruvian Jungle (Aidesep), the Confederation of Amazonian Nationalities of Peru (Conap), the Federation of Native Communities of Ucayali and Affluents (Feconau), and the Regional Union of the Indigenous Peoples of the Amazon of the Atalaya Province (Urpia).

During the dialogue, the Chief of Cabinet stressed that the Government has a serious commitment to advance with the land titling processes and that the Executive is not refusing, in any sense, to meet their demands. ?This Government is in no way refusing the titling process. Of course, we understand your inconvenience, but it must be emphasized that this Government is fully committed to advancing on this issue, "said the premier.

She recalled that she has a special interest in speeding up the territorial issue and has expressed her position on the matter many times. For this reason, he undertook to talk and coordinate with the Ministries of Agrarian Development and Irrigation, and of Economy and Finance to analyze the continuity of financing of the PTRT3 titling project by the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) and to finalize the processes that they were on the go.

It should be noted that the indigenous leaders of the native communities located in Lot 2 of Hu?nuco, Ucayali and Jun?n, request the immediate start of the second stage of the IDB's PTRT3 land titling project, as well as the protection of fauna and lands, which have been preyed upon by illegal mining and illegal loggers, among other lawsuits.
